medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain, nausea, and anorexia for approximately 10 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 10 days ago with right lower quadrant pain that was never severe. The patient continued to work last week despite the pain. Symptoms included persistent nausea and one episode of vomiting 3 days ago. The patient experienced ongoing anorexia and malaise, feeling generally unwell. Pain persisted, leading the patient to seek medical attention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, allergic rhinitis, eczema, external hemorrhoids, tinea pedis.
